judges: Before Bell, O. J., Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts and Pomeroy, JJ.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
The order of the Superior Court is reversed and the case remanded to the hearing court for the filing of a proper order in conformity with the Act of January 25, 1966, P. L. (1965) 1580, §10, 19 P.S. §1180-10 (Supp. 1969), which requires that “[t]he order finally disposing of the petition shall state grounds on which the case was determined and whether a federal or a state right was presented and decided.” See Commonwealth v. Naylor, 437 Pa. 193, 262 A. 2d 146 (1970).
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Dante R. D’Angelo, appellant, in propria persona.
Coa'oI Mary Los, Assistant District Attorney, and Robert W. Duggan, District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Commonwealth v. D’Angelo, Petitioner.
Before Bell, O. J., Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts and Pomeroy, JJ.
Dante R. D’Angelo, appellant, in propria persona.
Coa'oI Mary Los, Assistant District Attorney, and Robert W. Duggan, District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
April 10, 1970:
